thread.title: Chelsea plans to redevelop Stamford Bridge approved by Mayor of London
thread.title_full: Chelsea plans to redevelop Stamford Bridge approved by Mayor of London

author: ESPN staff
title: Chelsea plans to redevelop Stamford Bridge approved by Mayor of London
text:
Chelsea plans to redevelop Stamford Bridge approved by Mayor of London Antonio Conte has denied any contact or negotiations to manage Inter Milan. With Chelsea storming towards their fifth Premier League title, Bob Wilson has praised the 'extraordinary' Antonio Conte. 
Chelsea's application to redevelop Stamford Bridge has been approved by the Mayor of London. 
The state-of-the-art £500 million stadium will increase Chelsea's capacity from 41,600 to 60,000. 
Chelsea's plans include committing £12m to community activities and a £3.75m contribution toward affordable housing in the borough. 
The new stadium has been designed by the same architects as Bayern Munich's Allianz Arena and Beijing's Bird's Nest Olympic Stadium. 
Follow @ESPNFC on Twitter to keep up with the latest football updates.
